title: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Rentrée des Pommes [Apple Gathering], from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]", 1819–20
medium: Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper
provenance:
Collection H.N.
Spencer Samuels, New York
description: Lively courtyard scene with an apple orchard in the background.  A woman, upper right, receives a large wicker apple-filled basket from a woman below.  Some apples fall from the basket.  A young boy on the ground shields himself from the falling apples; another boy, right foreground bites into an apple while holding another.  A young man, center, carries a basket of apples, beside him, on the left, a young boy dangles a squirrel to frighted a young girl before him.  In the right rear, a young man holds a long implement below some tree branches  that collects apples from the tree.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Plate Design:  Rentrée des Pommes [Apple Gathering], from the Service des Objets de Dessert [Dessert Service]", 1819–20. Pen and brown/black ink, brush and brown wash, white gouache, red crayon, graphite on pink/tan paper mounted on blue/gray paper. 1989-13-10.
